## Tree class

A Tree is a core unit to construct a new tree with leaves. It watches changes of all leaf nodes and can traverse leaves. A resource is an important property which is marked as private to manage all leaf nodes.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Tree<T> implements View<T> 
```
<b>Implements:</b> [View](./treex.view.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [height](./treex.tree.height.md) |  | number | A height of a tree. |
|  [root](./treex.tree.root.md) |  | [TreeNode](./treex.treenode.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; | A root node in this tree |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [contains(node)](./treex.tree.contains.md) |  | It lets us know whether a node exists in a tree. |
|  [createTree(nodeProp)](./treex.tree.createtree.md) | <code>static</code> | This static method is the only way to build a new tree. |
|  [destroy()](./treex.tree.destroy.md) |  | Destory the resource of this tree. |
|  [find(predicate)](./treex.tree.find.md) |  | It tries to visit every node and apply a predicate to each node. When a result value of executing the predicate with a node is true, It stops visiting and return that node. |
|  [getNodes()](./treex.tree.getnodes.md) |  |  |

|  [onRemoved()](./treex.tree.onremoved.md) |  |  |

|  [onVisibilityChange()](./treex.tree.onvisibilitychange.md) |  | visibility events captured by all nodes |
